name: ClientApplication
description: FHIR Implementation of Client Metadata from https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7591#section-2

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The name of the client to be presented to the end-user.
The description of the client to be presented to the end-user.
Auth 2.0 grant type strings that the client can use at the token endpoint.
element.definition: The grant type for this client application.

element.short: String indicator of the requested authentication method for the token endpoint.
OAuth 2.0 response type strings that the client can use at the authorization endpoint.
This value is used by confidential clients to authenticate to the token endpoint, as described in OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749], Section 2.3.1.
element.definition: For client credentials (or other confidential authentication methods), the client secret.

Array of redirection URI strings for use in redirect-based flows such as the authorization code and implicit flows.  As required by Section 2 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749], clients using flows with redirection MUST register their redirection URI values. Authorization servers that support dynamic registration for redirect-based flows MUST implement support for this metadata value.
element.short: Array of redirection URI strings for use in redirect-based flows such as the authorization code and implicit flows.  As required by Section 2 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749], clients using flows with redirection MUST register their redirection URI values. Authorization servers that support dynamic registration for redirect-based flows MUST implement support for this metadata value.
URL string of a web page providing information about the client.
URL string that references a logo for the client.
String containing a space-separated list of scope values (as described in Section 3.3 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749]) that the client can use when requesting access tokens.
Array of strings representing ways to contact people responsible for this client, typically email addresses.

URL string that points to a human-readable terms of service document for the client that describes a contractual relationship between the end-user and the client that the end-user accepts when authorizing the client.
URL string that points to a human-readable privacy policy document that describes how the deployment organization collects, uses, retains, and discloses personal data.
